Name: Cindy Crawford Revlon
Description:
Cindy was decapitated. The exact date of her death is unknown, but her body was found several days later.

TvT partner organisation Centro de Apoyo a las Identidades Trans & Canal 44, 1.07.2017

Name: Larissa Valverde (Lolly)
Description:
Larissa was stabbed from behind with a screwdriver in a supermarket car park. The Civil Police also reported that the perpetrator (who has been arrested) introduced a vial of deodorant into her anus. He was arrested and confessed to the crime.

> A horrendous crime probably motivated by Transphobia happened this Sunday in the city of Sorriso, which is approximately 420 km from Cuiabá, capital of the state of Mato Grosso. According to the online news portal G1, Larissa Valverde, as she was known, was killed cruelly in the parking lot of a supermarket located in Bairro Jardim Alvorada. Her body was found just before dawn on Sunday (2).
>
> [deadname] Ferreira, 24, aka Larissa, was cowardly attacked from behind, she was hit by four blows from a sharp weapon which investigators believe is a screwdriver found near the body.
>
> According to the criminal expert, responsible for examining the crime scene, Larissa did not have any defense wounds, meaning that she was probably attacked by surprise by the murderer.

Her killer Cléverson dos Santos was arrested on 16th July 2017. In June 2021 he was sentenced to  to 15 years, 7 months and 14 days in prison for killing Larissa, and a further two years for mutilating her corpse.

> The Jury Court sentenced Cléverson dos Santos, known as “Zico”, to 15 years, 7 months and 14 days in prison in prison for killing Luiz Henrique Ferreira with a screwdriver and and two years for desecrating her corpse. He was also convicted of attempted theft from a church and a stationery store. All crimes were committed on the night of July 1, 2017, in the municipality of Sorriso (distant 394 km from Cuiabá).
>
> According to the complaint by the Public Ministry, before committing the murder, the defendant committed successive crimes, starting with an attempted theft in the Santa Luzia Parish, in the Industrial district. The theft didn't happen because Cléverson couldn't break the lock on the door. Faced with the failed attempt, the defendant continued his endeavor through the same neighborhood until he reached the Agape Stationery and Malharia. While he was trying to break down the door of the establishment, the owner shouted for help to the neighbors, causing him to flee the scene.
>
> Almost two hours later at 11:45 pm, in the Centro Sul neighborhood, Cléverson found the victim [deadname], who was a [trans woman], in the parking lot of a supermarket. Without any chance of defense, [deadname] was attacked with a screwdriver from behind, with the motive being one of low value. According to the autopsy examination the victim received four blows to the neck in total, dying instantly. After the victim was murdered, Cléverson desecrated the corpse by inserting a cylindrical plastic tube into her anus. 

Note that the TDoR 2017 list released by Transgender Europe (TGEU) in November 2017 gives her name as “Lola”.

Name: Ebony Morgan
Description:
Ebony was shot multiple times at home. She was taken to hospital where she was pronounced dead.

Though they are aware she was a transgender woman, authorities referred to Morgan by her dead name because she had not legally changed her name, according to the News & Advance. Police say prosecutors also are aware of Morgan’s gender identity and are investigating the homicide as a possible hate crime.

Name: Yadira Rodríguez Sánchez
Description:
Yadira was the manager of the La Clínica bar located on the Tehuacán-Teotitlán state highway.

Neighbours reported hearing shouting and called the police. When the police arrived, they found Yadira’s body with head injuries.

Note that the press reports relating to this case are contradictory - of the reports which name the victim, one reports her name as Yadira (M. A. Rodríguez Sánchez), age 26-28, and  other as Bernabé A, age 50.

Bernabé is a male given name, and as the second initials match and another report names the deceased as Yadira, age 50, Yadira Rodríguez Sánchez is probably the correct name and the age estimate of 26-28 is incorrect.

Note that TGEU incorrectly named her as Yadira Lopez Marroquin, which is the name of another victim from 16th April 2017.

Name: Anna Sophia
Description:
Anna was with her twin brother when the occupants of a vehicle shot her in the head. She died while being admitted to hospital.

A retired police sergeant confessed to the murder saying he “killed because he did not like homosexuals”.

In December 2021 Antônio Rego Sobrinho, was sentenced to 16 years and 9 months in prison for Anna's murder.

> Retired military policeman, Antônio Rego Sobrinho, was sentenced to 16 years and 9 months in prison in a closed regime for the murder of 16-year-old transsexual teenager Anna Sophia. The trial took place this Monday (13/12), at the 2nd Court of Jury of João Pessoa.
>
> According to the investigations and the complaint offered by the Public Ministry of Paraíba (criminal action 0008070-30.2017.8.15.2002), on the night of July 8, 2017, the defendant fired, without any prior discussion, several gunshots of fire against the victim, who was playing dominoes with friends in Praça Bela Vista, in the BairroEmployees II neighborhood. Although the teenager was rescued to a hospital in the Capital, she could not survive her injuries.

Name: Bruna dos Santos
Description:
Bruna was raped, beaten and shot.

A close friend of Bruna wrote about her on social networks ….
> 
> “… Who was Bruna? Bruna was a trans woman with a huge smile on her face, sadness inside but always knew how to bear everything, at age 11 she assumed homosexuality, at the age of 16 she assumed her feminine identity, everyone who knew her knew how happy she was.
> 
> On July 9, 2017 Bruna lost her life on a soccer field near her family’s home, where she was raped / punched in the face and shot, just another trans woman murdered for homophobia. Bruna did not have social networks and did not even like to take photos … She was a person who stayed away from cameras and social networks.”

Name: E. A. da Silva
Description:
E.A. was shot three times near Vila dos Bancários in Raul Lemos Square in Poço neighborhood in Maceió. She died at the scene.

> A [trans woman] was shot to death, near Vila dos Bancários, in Praça Raul Lemos, in the neighborhood of Poço, in Maceió. According to the 1st Battalion of the Military Police, the crime occurred around 4:30 am this Friday (21).
According to the police, the Battalion was called through an anonymous report. The [trans woman], who has not yet been identified, was hit by three shots.
>
> Police said there were still no suspects in the crime. The Criminalistics Institute went to the scene to do the body examination. The Legal Medical Institute and agents of the Homicide Police Station, who investigated the circumstances of the murder, also went to the scene.

According to the police the crime occurred around 4:30 am on Friday 21st July.

Name: Justine Doe
Description:
Justine was shot by a homeowner who found her in a basement. News reports portrayed her as a burglar, whereas it may be that she was homeless and seeking shelter.

> Police: DeKalb County homeowner shoots, kills intruder
> 
> LITHONIA, Ga. - Police need help identifying a [woman] suspected in a deadly home invasion early Monday, according to authorities.
> 
> DeKalb County Police said the [woman], who was wearing a wig and arched eyebrows, broke into a house on Beechwood Forest Drive just outside of Lithonia. The homeowner shot the [woman] in the stomach after [she] continued to walk towards him in a basement, according to investigators.
> 
> Lt. Lonzy Robertson told FOX 5's Marissa Mitchell the homeowner will likely not face charges in what is considered a "justifiable" shooting.
> 
> The deceased burglar is described as a dark-skinned black [woman], 5'6'' to 5'8'' weighing 180 pounds. Lt. Robertson said the [woman] was wearing a burgundy shirt and shorts at the time of the crime.

A comment on [a Reddit post about her case](https://www.reddit.com/r/UnresolvedMysteries/comments/jx98f7/tdor2020_shot_by_a_homeowner_and_died_in_hospital) gives some context to the possibility that she might have been homeless and seeking shelter:

> Possibly from the homeless population? Especially since no one seems to know who it is. Or abandoned by their family for being trans. Sad deal. I also always feel for the homeowners in this situation. It must weigh on them to take a life. But in all honesty if someone was walking towards me in my creepy basement I would shoot to, I can't imagine how scary that would be.
> 
> People from several surrounding states and a few more northerly states come to the Atlanta area when street homeless because it is warmer than basically every area north, east, and west of it. Metros in almost every direction like Saint Louis, Louisville, Washington are all much colder if you're homeless. So possibly being homeless may not be a bad guess.
> 
> I just wonder if this is the case, what steps do police take? As far as I know, there are few or no shelters in the Atlanta area that accept an adult transgender resident so were she homeless she likely did not even access services or sign in anywhere.

https://transdoetaskforce.org/new-forensic-image-of-justine-doe-2017

https://www.reddit.com/r/UnresolvedMysteries/comments/jx98f7/tdor2020_shot_by_a_homeowner_and_died_in_hospital

Name: Pamela Anabel Tabares
Description:
Pamela was a sex worker who lived in conditions of extreme vulnerability. She had been going to the Municipality for some time to ask for help but none had been forthcoming.

In the early hours of Wednesday, 26th July she was shot in the face, chest and leg on a rural road of the town of Pérez. Her body showed no other signs of violence.
 
Six 380-caliber shell casings were found at the scene.

Name: Monserrat Alejandra Carrizales Castro
Description:
Monserrat was a sex worker in the area of the highway to Nuevo Laredo, north of Monterrey.

She was beaten around the head and then shot dead. Her body was found on a plot of land in Ciénega de Flores, Nuevo León.

Police reported that her body showed signs of blows to the head, as well as several wounds by firearm on the skull, blood stains and signs that it had been dragged to the place where it was found. They speculate she was killed elsewhere and then her body dragged to the place where it was found.

https://ulisex.com/monserrat-carrizales-la-mujer-trans-asesinada-en-nuevo-leon/

Name: Name Unknown
Description:
Witnesses say that she was taken into a vehicle by people who identified her as trans and then killed her.

TvT partner organisation Centro de Apoyo a las Identidades Trans & La Prensa Salara 02.08.2017

Name: Kajal
Description:
Kajal’s throat was cut by her partner, a 26 year old man named Saurav. After killing her he surrendered to the police.

> PATNA: A 26-year-old man walked into Alamganj police station in blood stained clothes on Friday midnight and claimed he had murdered his transgender partner with whom he had physical relationship for over six years.
>
> The man, Saurav Suman, then guided the police to his medical shop at Gai Ghat from where the body of the transgender, Kajal (40), was recovered around 2am. The body was lying in a pool of blood when the police reached the spot.
>
> SHO of Alamganj police station Om Prakash said Saurav has confessed to killing Kajal. “It seems the murder was fallout of a property dispute between Saurav and Kajal. The latter had made Saurav nominee while buying a plot of land,” he added. The SHO said Saurav told police that he slit Kajal’s throat with a surgical blade inside his shop. Kajal was living in a rented house at Gud Ki Mandi while Saurav is a resident of Kazibagh.

https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/patna/26-yr-old-kills-transgender-partner-surrenders/articleshow/59825134.cms

https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/patna/youth-in-blood-soaked-clothes-surrenders-after-murdering-transgender-partner-in-patna/articleshow/59824165.cms

Description:
The victim was shot in the head. According to witnesses her body was thrown from a moving gray truck onto a dirt road that leads from the town of San Miguel 30 to Acamilpa.

Name: Aurinete Aldemir de Sousa
Description:
Aurinete was ambushed in a street near her home by three suspects who stabbed her in the neck.

> A [trans woman] died after being stabbed in the rural area of ​​the municipality of Patos do Piauí. Aurinete de Sousa was taken by a man, on a motorcycle, to a deserted street, at the entrance of Morro da Onça. The place is only 50 meters from the victim's house lived with the family. According to Sergeant Vila Nova, of the Military Police of Patos do Piauí, three people were said to have participated in the crime, which took place around 12:30 am. 
>
> Sergeant Vila Nova says that a single dagger blow would have been delivered to the victim's neck. Aurinete managed to escape and arrive at her home. She was rescued and taken to the Regional Hospital of Picos, but did not survive her injuries.
